intro: Erigeron affinis, commonly known as common fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open areas such as prairies, roadsides, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Erigeron affinis is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
